conclusion: Analyze the process A→B on the P-V diagram of the Stirling cycle.
For an isothermal process involving an ideal gas, internal energy remains constant.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
During A→B, gas expands from lower to higher volume.
Since gas expands, work done (W) is positive.
Since the process is isothermal, ΔU = 0.
Substitute ΔU = 0 into the first law: Q = W.
Gas absorbs heat to supply energy for work during expansion.
The gas absorbs heat when moving from state A to state B.
